description.en: The course will be held in English only (students can ask advice from each other in case of random words when needed), during the course the students are familiarized with English texts from their field, watch video clips and discuss the topics related to information management.
description.et: Kursus toimub läbinisti ingliskeelsena (vajaduse korral on võimalik üksikute sõnade puhul üksteiselt nõu küsida), kursuse vältel toimub erialaste ingliskeelsete tekstidega tutvumine, klippide vaatamine ja eeskätt erialaste teemade üle arutlemine.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to improve the information management related English language skills of the students from the information management curriculum. To do so, the relevant readings and recordings from this field will be worked through, and the conversations about the relevant issues will be held.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärkideks on parendada infokorralduse õppekava üliõpilaste erialase inglise keele oskust asjakohaste erialaste tekstide ja videomaterjalide läbitöötamise ning vestluse arendamise kaudu.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course the student:
1. is able to have a short presenation in English language on a topic of her own choice;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. oskab ainekursuse lõpus läbi viia lühikese ingliskeelse erialase ettekande enda valitud teemal;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. understands popular scientific conversations in English-speaking media (on the basis of relevant video clips);
learning_outcomes.et: 2. saab aru populaarteaduslikest vestlustest ingliskeelses meedias (videoklippide põhjal);

learning_outcomes.en: 3. is able to seek information about relevant International events from the field of information management (conferences, seminars, webinars, etc);
learning_outcomes.et: 3. oskab leida infot erialaste võõrkeelsete sündmuste (konverents, seminar, webinar jt) kohta;

learning_outcomes.en: 4. has participated at least in one English-language field-related event (conference, seminar etc);
learning_outcomes.et: 4. on külastanud vähemalt üht erialaga seotud võõrkeelset sündmust (konverents, seminar jne),

learning_outcomes.en: 5. is able to pay attention to contemporary field-related issues;
learning_outcomes.et: 5. oskab pöörata tähelepanu kaasaegsetele erialastele probleemidele,

learning_outcomes.en: 6. has obtained skills to academically reflect upon the event;
learning_outcomes.et: 6. on omandanud oskused sündmuse akadeemiliseks reflekteerimiseks,

learning_outcomes.en: 7. is more fluent on reading easier texts in English, related to her field, and gives others a short overview of the texts.
learning_outcomes.et: 7. oskab lihtsamaid erialases inglise keeles kirjutatud tekste kiiresti lugeda ja teistele ülevaadet anda.

independent_work.et:
Task 1. Find at least 10 terms or keywords (+ definitions) related to IM that you think that MUST BE explained to your fellow students (specific topics are distributed during intro course).
Task 2.-5. Keeping in mind the next seminar: find one relevant article, video, podcast, etc from news or social media, read it and be prepared to talk about it to others.
Task 6. Find from the Internet or choose from the list an Information Management related conference presentation or webinar. Watch and listen to it, and prepare yourself to talk about it to others.
Before the final seminar: Prepare your presentation about your topic (Prezi, slides, white board are an option, but not a must)

description.et:
All 6 materials you have prepared are discussed during the following seminar which means that the material and/or your notes about it should be available when you attend the seminar.

You also have to prepare 1-3 slides for each seminar, so that it would be easier for your group members to follow you.

The topic is up to you - nevertheless, it should be from the field of Information Management! You can choose a topic we haven't discussed before (data management systems, time management, etc), or focus on a topic that we have already discussed (book history, fighting fake news, or something else). Your presentation must be based on at least two resources, so that this time, it is not just retelling a video or an article.

You have 5 minutes for your presentation!
I warmly recommend to use slides, Prezi or other presentation materials!

You can do it two ways: paper-based or in a text file. I recommend you the paper-based Study Diary in case you need take a look at your notes during presenting to others. Paper-based Study Diary is also useful to write things through slowly, helping you to memorize things better. It also helps you to avoid online distractions while listening to others' presentations - our previous experiences with fellow students have shown that it is particularly hard to keep focus on seminars during online classes. Sometimes, it can even be hard for the lecturer! That's why I recommend you to prefer a paper-based Study Diary.

The Study Diary should contain your:
* study goals and other Very Important Remarks from the first seminar,
* notes about new terms you have introduced during the second seminar,
* notes about materials you have read, watched or listened during the course,
* notes about new ideas, words, and phrases you have heard from others during the course,
* the final post, containing answers to the questions: Did you have your plans fulfilled and goals met? The most important things you learned? What did you miss on this course?

grade_evaluation.et:
The "pass" result is granted after:
*	7 seminars - contact-based activities - 5 seminars present 
*	6 prep works to be taken with you
*	Study diary - to be written during the course
*	The presentation on a final seminar

description.et: Introduction. Self-assessment. Making plans and setting goals for the course. Setting up your study diary. Distributing the topics to discuss glossary.
Our glossary. Starting from the common topics, terms and keywords.
Cool IM-related software, hardware, apps, etc - sharing your findings about ICT-related articles.
Going back to the roots - the history of IM related disciplines. Rarities and interesting discoveries from the collections of GLAM institutions.

Children and reading and Internet - as you plan to become an information specialist, the topic 'children and reading and Internet' is probably one of the things that we need to think/discuss about today.

We know there's a lot of information on the Internet that is not reliable at all. How to distinguish crap from a medicine? How to distinguish a refugee from a criminal? How to make use of the information on the Internet when there is so much of it and you have little time to evaluate it?

Information Management related scholarly or practical conferences, webinars, and other materials. There are plenty of recordings from the past conferences or webinars that might inspire you before the upcoming seminar.
Please make sure that you ask the course instructor about the suitability of the recording you are going to watch beforehand! Some links to useful materials will also be distributed!
